ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: in depth research and source management, time management, writing skills,
I learned how to critically evaluate historical documents, particularly archival documents, and synthesize them into a concise argument.
I learned how to write a thesis.

I gained a much better understanding of how to organize a large writing project. It was enjoyable, interacting with archives and using the tremendous resources of the Yale library to locate digitized primary sources.
My thesis project taught me a lot about the process of writing a history paper from end to finish, really understanding the scope of an issue and placing it into sociohistorical context

- Analytical skills (analyzing primary sources, drawing connections between sources, gathering effective quotes and examples from sources)
- How to talk about my research with peers, how to present on my research
- Building writing stamina (writing ever day to produce a long piece)

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Really depends on your advisor. That being said, I was lucky to have an amazing advisor and she deserves all of the praise in the world.

I think this course was well-structured, but very dependent on the advisor. My advisor was wonderful, but I think if I didn't have the internal deadlines set by my advisor, it would have been trickier because the department deadlines jump from very small assignments to the entire draft being done without many intermediary deadlines.
Given the nature of the course, I dont see any real weaknesses. This, of course would be dependent on the supervisors engagement and involvement.
I loved the close mentorship I got with my mentor and I thought the schedule for due dates helped facilitate the slow development of a thesis

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Great experience that taught me a lot about myself as a student and allowed me to track my growth and improve my writing!
I think that the requirement to complete a senior thesis is one of the real strengths of the Yale curriculum. I would highly recommend this process to anybody.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student! I think this is an important research experience that I wouldn't have gotten to have otherwies
